source: a miss is as good as a mile
lemma: a miss is as good as a mile
definitions: A complete failure is no different from a narrow failure.
Even a small error can lead to complete failure.
Coming close to achieving something but failing is the same as not achieving it at all.
examples: He almost caught the ball, but a miss is as good as a mile, and they lost the game.
She nearly won the lottery, but a miss is as good as a mile, so she's still broke.
You might have been close to finishing the project, but a miss is as good as a mile when it comes to deadlines.
